content: this pattern was created with inspiration from the mighty old oak trees with all their branches that reach out from the middle trunk the pattern is also available for free on my website www meandmyyarn me/oakravelry-web in english the pdf here on ravelry eng us terms also includes charts / diagrams for the shawl pattern which the website does not a video tutorial is also available for this pattern on main pattern video tutorial http //www meandmyyarn me/oakoflifevideo edge pattern video tutorial http //www meandmyyarn me/oakoflifevideoedge if you like this pattern and want to support me in making more patterns for you to enjoy buy this pattern as a pdf-version that way you ll have a nice looking printable version that lasts forever and ever and i can keep creating patterns to keep you happily crocheting until your hook s on fire like that would stop anyone of us from crocheting really not but anyway you get the picture - i m hoping you enjoy this pattern **yarn and hook** i used the hobbii metallico yarn 50 g 1 75 oz / skein 50 g 115 m 126 yds yarn weight is medium and i used a 5 mm hook an h or a 8 the pattern uses 3 5 skeins for the main part of the pattern rosaline here color a and 1 5 skeins for the edge sky blue metallic here color b so a total of about 600 meters but you need 4 skeins for the main color and 2 skeins for the edge color **shawl size** measurements after blocking tip to base 74 cm or 32 inches bas longest side 162 cm or 64 inches **stitches used** slip_stitch chain single_crochet double_crochet triple treble crochet puff two double_crochet together chain space and two versions of picots **pattern includes** * complete video tutorial for both main part and edge part let s crochet this together * stitch count for the first 9 row before the repeats starts to keep you on the right track from there you will definitely have gotten the hang of it to continue * complete stitch count for all 11 edge row * charts / diagrams for both main pattern part and the edge part * written instructions for the puff and the two double_crochet together * yarn and hook tips as well as other tips and things that is good to know along the way when needed * shawl size measurements with an explanatory scheme * step by step instructions with snapshots from the video tutorial to help you understand the written instructions and don t forget that you can always go back to the video if you have any questions or wanna double check something
